content:
Senior Mike Carrano right celebrates a goal during a  win against Delaware PERIOD

ACHA Hockey

Even though it was way back when his Afro was in full effect Joe Battista can still vividly remember his senior day as an Icer PERIOD

 Battista said PERIOD

Tomorrow seven seniors will play in their final home game at the Greenberg Ice Pavilion against Washington  Jefferson PERIOD The seven are comprised of two fifthyear seniors two secondyear transfer players and three guys who have played for four straight years PERIOD

Among the seven is senior captain Kevin Jaeger PERIOD As it stands Jaeger is second alltime on the Icers goalscoring list with  PERIOD

 Battista said PERIOD

Jaegers exploits on the ice have been well documented throughout his career PERIOD But a couple of his teammates have at best struggled to even play on senior day PERIOD Chris Rome is one such player PERIOD

Rome has suffered through an injuryriddled senior year with the Icers PERIOD He feels fortunate that hes finally healthy enough to play PERIOD

 Rome said PERIOD

Battista said he always remembers some unique things about each graduating class hes had since hes been head coach here PERIOD

He calls senior Greg Windsor the unsung hero of the bunch PERIOD For three straight seasons Windsor has been the recipient of The John Dufford ICE Intense Consistent Effort Award given to the Icer who displays maximum effort day in and day out PERIOD

In his eyes Garret Divins is a guy wholl be remembered as more of a role player PERIOD But his efforts this year as a checking forward have been beneficial PERIOD

Battista wants his seniors to enjoy the day but hopes they remember theres a game to win PERIOD Because he forgot too PERIOD

 Battista said PERIOD

Regardless of the outcome this weekend the Icers have cemented their spot as the No PERIOD  seed at nationals which the seniors can definitely look forward to PERIOD

 Battista said PERIOD
